title: new​
content: </> AlertLibrary:new( player: Player ,-- Player to be sent title: string,-- Title of the alert description: string,-- Description of the alert close: string,-- The close button textDefualt: "Close" lightTheme: boolean-- Whether it should be light theme or no Defualt: false ) → () Creates an alert to a single player.

title: new​
content: </> SwitchLibrary:new() → SwitchReturnLibrary Creates a new switch

title: Description​
content: This module is to help developers to develop normal UIs

title: Locked​
content: </> SwitchReturnLibrary.Locked: boolean Whether or not the toggler should not be actived.

title: Value​
content: </> SwitchReturnLibrary.Value: boolean Whether or not the toggler is toggled on.

title: setParent​
content: </> SwitchReturnLibrary:setParent( t: ScreenGui | BillboardGui | Frame | TextLabel | ImageLabel | TextBox | ImageButton | TextButton | CanvasGroup -- The parent of the switch ) → () Sets the parent of the switch

title: setLock​
content: </> SwitchReturnLibrary:setLock( t: boolean-- Should it be locked? Default: true ) → () Set whether the switch should response when the user clicked

title: setPosition​
content: </> SwitchReturnLibrary:setPosition( y: UDim2 -- The position of the switch ) → () Sets the position of the switch

title: setAnchorPoint​
content: </> SwitchReturnLibrary:setAnchorPoint( y: Vector2 -- The anchor point of the switch ) → () Sets the AnchorPoint property of the switch

title: setSize​
content: </> SwitchReturnLibrary:setSize( y: UDim2 -- Size of the switch ) → () Sets the Size of the switch

title: setPadding​
content: </> SwitchReturnLibrary:setPadding( x: numberPaddingonx-asis(offset), y: numberPaddingony-axis(offset) ) → () Sets the padding of the switch button

title: setBgColor​
content: </> SwitchReturnLibrary:setBgColor( x: Color3 -- Color of the background of the switch ) → () Sets the background color of switch

title: setCorner​
content: </> SwitchReturnLibrary:setCorner( c: UDim -- The corner udim property should be set to the switch ) → () Sets the CornerRadius property of the switch

title: setButtonColor​
content: </> SwitchReturnLibrary:setButtonColor(c: Color3 Colorofthetoggler) → () Sets the switch toggler color

title: noTween​
content: </> SwitchReturnLibrary:noTween() → () Removes tween for switch toggler movement

title: tween​
content: </> SwitchReturnLibrary:tween() → () Adds tween for switch toggler movement

title: setEnabledColor​
content: </> SwitchReturnLibrary:setEnabledColor( c: Color3 -- The color of the toggler when enabled ) → () Sets the switch toggler color when enabled

title: setDisableColor​
content: </> SwitchReturnLibrary:setDisableColor( c: Color3 -- The color of the toggler when disabled ) → () Sets the switch toggler color when disabled

title: setButtonCorner​
content: </> SwitchReturnLibrary:setButtonCorner( c: UDim -- The button cornerRadius property ) → () Sets the button corner (switch toggler)

title: setBorder​
content: </> SwitchReturnLibrary:setBorder( c: UIStroke -- Provide UIStroke, if already exists, return false instead. ) → () Sets the main border of the switch

title: setButtonSize​
content: </> SwitchReturnLibrary:setButtonSize( x: number-- The scale size of the toggler. Max: 0.5 ) → () Sets the switch toggler size

title: Example
content: -- LocalScript (Recommended) local player = game:GetService"Players".LocalPlayer local _L = require(path.to.BetterUI).Switch -- Replace with the BetterUI Interface you placed into! ReplicatedStorage is recommended. local gs = player.PlayerGui.gameGui -- what your gui named (Gui Instance is required for it to work!!!) local g = _L.new() g:setParent(gs) -- replace with the parent you want to set!! g:setPosition(UDim2.new(0.5, 0, 0.5, 0)) g:setAnchorPoint(Vector2.new(0.5, 0.5)) g:setSize(UDim2.new(0, 100, 0, 30)) -- Replace with scale if you want. g:setPadding(5, 5) g:setBgColor(Color3.new(0.001, 0.001, 0.001)) g:setCorner(UDim.new(0, 2048)) g:setEnableColor(Color3.fromRGB(0, 255, 0)) g:setDisableColor(Color3.fromRGB(255, 0, 0)) g:setButtonCorner(UDim.new(0, 2048)) g:setButtonSize(0.5)
